title: OOM when allocating tensor with shape[128,12,256,256] and type float on
body:
**Describe the bug**
I am using the google colab to run the Ludwig in Python program. I am running on GPU. Here is my program:
**To Reproduce**
import pandas as pd
from ludwig.api import LudwigModel
from ludwig.utils.data_utils import add_sequence_feature_column

model_definition = {'input_features': [{'name': 'Review_Text', 'type': 'text','encoder': 'bert',
'config_path': 'bert_config.json',
'checkpoint_path': 'bert_model.ckpt'}],
'output_features': [{'name': 'Final_Coding', 'type': 'category'}],
'training': {'epochs': 3, 'learning_rate': 0.001},
'preprocessing': {'tokenizer': 'bert', 'vocab_file': 'vocab.txt'}}

df = pd.read_csv('train_test.csv')
df['Final_Coding'] = df['Final_Coding'].fillna(0)
ludwig_model = LudwigModel(model_definition)

train_size = int(0.6 * len(df))
vali_size = int(0.2 * len(df))

df['split'] = 0

df.loc[
    (
        (df.index.values >= train_size) &
        (df.index.values < train_size + vali_size)
    ),
    ('split')
] = 1
df.loc[
    df.index.values >= train_size + vali_size,
    ('split')
] = 2

train = df[df['split']==0]
validation = df[df['split']==1]
test = df[df['split']==2]

train_stat,_,_=ludwig_model.train(dataset=df)

When I ran the last statement it throws following error:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25621662/114541074-5cc94600-9caa-11eb-8a94-7a3ae1ad5d61.png)

I am not sure what is the issue and how to fix it. I am newbie in ludwig. Any help would be really appreciated.


**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: [e.g. iOS]
 - Version [e.g. 22]
- Python version: Py 3.6.7
- Ludwig version -0.3.3.

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.
